thing-type.label: TZ36D Dual Paddle Wall Switch
thing-type.description: Dual Paddle Wall Switch<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThe TKB Z-Wave dual wall switch is switching attached loads and is controlled either by the local switching paddle or remotely via the Z-Wave wireless protocol<br /&gtIt is included and controlled in a Z-Wave network by a remote control, a wireless control centre or any other kind of Z-Wave controller including a PC-software.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtPress On/Off button three times within 1.5 seconds.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtPress On/Off button three times within 1.5 seconds.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Night light
parameter.description: LED behaviour control.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtFrom the manual: The LED on the switch will by default, turn ON when the load attached is turned OFF. To make the LED turn ON when the attached load is turned ON, set the parameter 1 to a value of 1.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Memory function
parameter.description: Memory function behaviour control.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtFrom the manual: Default value is 1, when the value is 0, switch memory function not open; when the value is 1, open switch memory function.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Invert switch
parameter.description: Swap top and bottom switch/button.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtTo switch top and bottom switch, set this parameter to 1.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: LED transmission indication
parameter.description: LED transmission indication<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtTranmission indication behaviour control.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter controls the LED behaviour when transmitting data to any of the group members.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Flicker for 1 second at the beginning

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Suspend group 4
parameter.description: Group 4 command sending behaviour control.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDisable transmitting commands to Group 4.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Sending commands to Group 4 is enabled.
Do not sen commands to Group 4.
